title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 203.6 - Duties and responsibilities of the advisory board
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 203.6 - Duties and responsibilities of the advisory board

State Regulations

It shall be the duty of the advisory board to advise and
assist the commissioner in all matters pertaining to the operation of this
program, subject only to such limitations as may be prescribed in section
294
of the Agriculture and Markets Law. Such duties may specifically include any or
all of the following: (a) the
recommendation to the commissioner of administrative rules and regulations
relating to the program; (b) recommending to the commissioner such amendments to the program as seem
advisable; (c) the preparation and
submission to the commissioner of the estimated budget required for the proper
operation of the program; (d) recommending to the commissioner methods for assessing members of the industry
and methods for collecting the necessary funds; (e) assisting the commissioner in the
collection and assembling of information and data necessary to the proper
administration of the order; and
(f) the performance of such other duties in
connection with the program as the commissioner shall designate. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
203.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
